alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 18 at 4:21PM HST until February 19 at 12:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL NOON SUNDAY FOR THE BIG ISLAND SUMMITS... .A deep layer of moisture will continue to stream over the Big Island through Monday. Temperatures at summit level will remain near or below freezing and a mix of heavy snow and freezing rain will persist through at least noon Sunday. Travel to the summits is extremely dangerous and life threatening with snow and ice covered roadways. Additionally, gusty winds will produce blowing and drifting snow, as well as zero visibility at times. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON HST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and freezing rain. Up to a foot of additional snow is expected along with significant icing. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...Until noon HST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel to the summits will be life threatening and impossible. The road to the Mauna Kea summit remains closed. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times, with periods of zero visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are also possible. This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. Any travel plans to the summits should be postponed until the threat diminishes.
